meanings.definition: The front of an advancing wave.
meanings.sent1: The wavefront moved steadily towards the shore.
meanings.sent2: I could see the wavefront approaching from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The wavefront decided to take a break and let the smaller waves go first.
meanings.sent4: The wavefront crashed against the rocks with a powerful force.
meanings.sent5: The wavefront loomed ominously, ready to engulf everything in its path.

meanings.definition: A surface representing corresponding points of a wave in phase.
meanings.sent1: The wavefront displayed the synchronized movement of the water particles.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the wavefront to understand the behavior of waves.
meanings.sent3: The wavefront threw a party for all the synchronized waves in the ocean.
meanings.sent4: The wavefront painted a beautiful picture of harmony in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The wavefront danced gracefully, each particle perfectly in sync with the others.
